keyword: calories in a cinnamon and raisin bagel
title: Calories in a Cinnamon and Raisin Bagel
meta_description: Discover calories in a cinnamon and raisin bagel, including carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown per bagel with quick tweaks and FAQs.
h1: Calories in a Cinnamon and Raisin Bagel
assumptions: Standard medium bagel (~71 g), commercially baked with raisins and cinnamon, no added toppings or spreads.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, size, recipe, and baking method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A cinnamon and raisin bagel provides ~270 kcal, mostly from carbs with some natural sugars from raisins.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a cinnamon and raisin bagel?
faqs.a: Approximately 270 kcal for one standard bagel.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a cinnamon raisin bagel?
faqs.a: About 56 g total carbs, including 2 g fiber and 7 g sugars from raisins.

faqs.q: Is a cinnamon and raisin bagel high in protein?
faqs.a: It has around 9 g protein, moderate for a carb-focused baked good.

faqs.q: How does sodium compare in cinnamon raisin bagels?
faqs.a: Typically 440 mg per bagel, varying by brand and added salt.

faqs.q: Are cinnamon raisin bagels healthier than plain?
faqs.a: Similar calories, but added raisins provide some fiber and natural sweetness; opt for whole grain for more nutrients.
